name: NSOpenGLPixelFormat
desc: An object that specifies the types of buffers and other attributes of the OpenGL context. DeprecatedThe OpenGL API is deprecated. Use Metal and MetalKit instead.

items.name: init?(cglPixelFormatObj: CGLPixelFormatObj)
items.desc: Returns an OpenGL pixel format object initialized with using an existing CGL pixel format object.

items.name: init?(attributes: UnsafePointer<NSOpenGLPixelFormatAttribute>)
items.desc: Returns an OpenGL pixel format object initialized with specified pixel format attributes.

items.name: var cglPixelFormatObj: CGLPixelFormatObj?
items.desc: The low-level, platform-specific Core OpenGL (CGL) pixel format object represented by the receiver.

items.name: func getValues(UnsafeMutablePointer<GLint>, forAttribute: NSOpenGLPixelFormatAttribute, forVirtualScreen: GLint)
items.desc: Gets the value for the specified pixel format attribute.

items.name: var numberOfVirtualScreens: GLint
items.desc: The number of virtual screens associated with the OpenGL pixel format.
